H0.text: Size is the information missing when a student is given the volume and description of a substance and is asked to determine its density.

H1.text: Mass is the information missing when a student is given the volume and description of a substance and is asked to determine its density.

H2.text: Boiling point is the missing information needed for the student to determine the density of the substance when only its volume and description are given.

H3.text: Melting point is the information missing when a student, given the volume and description of a substance, is asked to determine its density.

A4.text: Density is calculated as the ratio of mass to volume (œÅ = m/V), where mass is normally measured with a scale or balance.
